meanings.definition: To play around or engage in rough or boisterous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children were horsing around in the playground.
meanings.sent2: The siblings enjoyed horsing around in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: After finishing their homework, the kids started horsing around in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The puppies were horsing around in the park, chasing each other joyfully.
meanings.sent5: The friends spent the afternoon horsing around at the beach, laughing and having fun.

meanings.definition: To provide with a horse or horses.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was horsing his wagon to transport the harvest.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys horsing her guests around the ranch on horseback.
meanings.sent3: The knight was horsing his loyal squire for the upcoming journey.
meanings.sent4: The cowboy was horsing his trusty steed before the rodeo competition.
meanings.sent5: The equestrian was horsing her prized stallion for the show jumping event.

meanings.definition: To move or carry something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: The movers were horsing the piano up the stairs carefully.
meanings.sent2: He was horsing the large box into the truck with great effort.
meanings.sent3: The workers were horsing the heavy equipment across the construction site.
meanings.sent4: The team was horsing the massive sculpture into the art gallery for display.
meanings.sent5: The athletes were horsing the weights in the gym to build strength and endurance.
